WorkItem.ClosedComment: This is addressed in Prism 5.0 with Prism.Composition and Prism.PubSubEvents assemblies. Prism.Composition contains logging, modularity, regions. Prism.PubSubEvents contains events. The PubSubEvents assembly is PCL.
WorkItem.Description:
I wanted to throw out a request for consideration, namely breaking out common functionality in the Prism assembly that can be used in other hosted application contexts (such as WCF-Hosted or Windows Services Applications) that are not presentation-specific.
 
This assembly (perhaps named "Prism.Core") would host all the non-WPF-specific functionality, such as:
 
- Events 
- Modularity 
- Logging 
- Other? 
 
There's a lot of great functionality in these namespaces.  Applications should be able to leverage this functionality in other application contexts without having to reference WPF-specific libraries.
WorkItem.Summary: Extract Core Application Functionality to Core Assembly (Prism.Core)

Comments.Message: I created a somewhat similar issue, except that I stated it should be taken further and placed in a .NET 4.5 Portable Class Library: http://compositewpf.codeplex.com/workitem/9617
